content.content: Basic Details Project Name: Optiland Quests Author name and contact info: Cryptofox L2 recipient address: 0x14fF422F5bacc52E20BE81B184F4CE1f0367402B Which Voting Cycle are you applying for?: Cycle 11 I confirm that I have read the landing pages for the Builders and Growth Experiments Sub-Committees and that I have determined my proposal is best suited to be reviewed by the Growth Experiments Sub-Committee: [Yes/No]: Yes I understand that Growth Experiments grants are subject to a “no sale rule,” as explained in this post, and I have read the terms of the rule: [Yes/No]: Yes Project Details: What are you building?: Optiland NFT series consists of 4 NFT collections - Optimistic Bunnies, Pixel Bunnies, Optiland Citizens, and Sad Bunnies. Optimistic Bunnies NFT was the first NFT collection to deploy on Optimism. The 4 collections have around 9000 holders combined, making it one of the largest NFT communities on Optimism. We also donated more than 6ETH toward Optimism Public Goods Funding. We look to continue our collaboration with other dapp projects in the Optimism Ecosystem. Why do you believe what you are building is going to succeed?: As the first NFT deployed on Optimism, we have one of the largest communities of NFT holders on optimism. A lot of our NFT holders are actively participating in other communities on Optimism as well. The team has also demonstrated integrity by delivering on its project roadmap. The team has built a lot of good will with many communities on Optimism. The project will find success by continuing to develop good will and partnership with other communities on Optimism. How many users does your project have currently? Please include how you arrived at this estimate: There are 4 NFT collections in the Optiland NFT series. There are around 9000 holders of the NFTs based on Etherscan token tracker Optimistic Bunnies:    Optimistic Ethereum L2 Explorer   Optimistic Bunnies (Bunny) Token Tracker | Optimism Optimistic Bunnies (Bunny) Token Tracker on Etherscan shows the price of the Token $0.0000, total supply 3,898, number of holders 2,367 and updated information of the token. The token tracker page also shows the analytics and historical data.      Pixel Bunnies    Optimistic Ethereum L2 Explorer   Pixel Bunnies (PBUNNY) Token Tracker | Optimism Pixel Bunnies (PBUNNY) Token Tracker on Etherscan shows the price of the Token $0.0000, total supply 3,894, number of holders 2,427 and updated information of the token. The token tracker page also shows the analytics and historical data.      Optiland Citizens    Optimistic Ethereum L2 Explorer   Optiland Citizens (OC) Token Tracker | Optimism Optiland Citizens (OC) Token Tracker on Etherscan shows the price of the Token $0.0000, total supply 4,178, number of holders 3,990 and updated information of the token. The token tracker page also shows the analytics and historical data.      Pixel Bunnies    Optimistic Ethereum L2 Explorer   SadBunnies (SAD) Token Tracker | Optimism SadBunnies (SAD) Token Tracker on Etherscan shows the price of the Token $0.0000, total supply 360, number of holders 266 and updated information of the token. The token tracker page also shows the analytics and historical data.      How will receiving a grant enable you to further the mission of maximizing the number of users interacting with Optimism? Please include a step-by-step flow of how you imagine this grant can lead to a greater number of user interactions with Optimism: The grant will be used to incentivize program participants to learn more about the different dapps on Optimism through a series of “learn and earn”. As program participants become more educated about the dapps, they will most likely start to try out those dapps, potentially increasing their participation in the Optimism ecosystem and drive OP token and gas usage. Tell us about the users you plan to target with this grant. Include any defining characteristics that will help you identify and target them. We will target current Optiland NFT owners, users of other dapps on Optimism, and Ethereum users from the main net. We will aim to increase both the number of users (breadth) and also the depth of their involvement in the Optimism ecosystem. How would these users interact with Optimism? For how long?: NFTs are often the gateway for onboarding an user with an ecosystem. In 2021, Opensea accounted for a large volume of gas usage on Ethereum main net, which is one of the main reasons that drove L2 adoption. We will use the OP tokens as an incentive for program participants to interact with the Optiland NFT tokens plus the Optimism dapps that we will introduce to the program participants. As participants learn more about the dapps that exist in the Optimism ecosystem, they will be more likely to try those dapps; thus increasing the likelihood that they will stay engaged within the Optimism ecosystem as a power user. The program aims to create a group of Optimism power users who would stay engaged in the Optimism ecosystem. Provide us with links to any of the following for the project: Website: https://www.optiland.xyz/ Twitter: https://twitter.com/OPBunnies Discord: Optimistic Bunnies Do you have any metrics on the project currently? (TVL, transactions, volume, unique addresses, etc. Optimism metrics preferred; please link to public sources such as Dune Analytics, etc.): Optimistic Bunnies: Holders - 2364, Sales - 1100, market cap - 109 ETH    CoinGecko    Optimistic Bunnies NFT Floor Price Chart | CoinGecko Browse Optimistic Bunnies NFT price floor, chart, trading volume, rarity traits, and more.      Pixel Bunnies: Holders - 2427, sales - 392, market cap - 3.42ETH Optiland Citizens: Holders - 3993, sales - 342, market cap - 4.92ETH Sad Bunnies: Holders - 267, sales - 11, market cap - 1ETH Who are your competitors, and are they on Optimism?: OptiChads and Bored Town are similar NFT projects on Optimism. Please link to code audits (if any): No audit Team Who are your founders?: Cryptofox and distractionboy What makes your team well-suited to carry out the project described in this proposal? Both Cryptofox and distractionboy has been involved in the Optimism NFT ecosystem since its inception. We both have demonstrated integrity and delivered on key milestones as outlined in their roadmap. We will both continue to deliver on our project and the grant proposal. Is this your first Web3 project?: No If not, what else have you built? (Share links, Github repository, or any other useful information.): distractionboy worked with the collab.land team to implement its discord bot to support Optimism network. It’s used in almost all Optimism NFT projects. He also helped to build Optichads NFT Grant Request What is the size of the grant request?: 20,000 OP How do you justify the size of the grant?: We plan to distribute the grant over 16 weeks, making 1,250 weekly distributions to the Optiland NFT community. Given the potential for thousands of participants in the project, the size seems appropriate. Roadmap and Distribution Plan Describe in discrete steps how you will successfully implement your grant plan: How will the OP tokens be distributed? Over what period will the tokens be distributed for each initiative? Proposal for token distribution:  We will use quest3 as a platform to set up weekly “learn and earn” quests to program participants. 100% of the tokens will be distributed to participants over 16 weeks. A different Optimism dapp will be selected each week for participants to learn. Participants would need to write a short description of what they learned about the dapp to qualify for the weekly OP reward. A manual review will then be taken at the end of the week to verify the validity of the participants’ submissions.  See mock quest example: Learn and Earn Examp The weekly quests will aim to create a community of power users within the Optimism ecosystem. Learning about the different protocols selected during the weekly quests is the first step toward increasing the usage of different protocols in the Optimism ecosystem and will likely bring more users to Optimism. Please provide benchmark milestones for this project. These milestones should guide the Optimism community on the progress of your project throughout your work on the project. Do not use distribution of the grant itself as a milestone: Milestones can be measured on:  Milestones will be met weekly and will include a weekly quest and a review of the quest from the previous week.  A new quest will be launched every Sunday and publicize it on Optiland’s Twitter and Discord accounts.  Public metrics such as how many users attempted a quest and completed a quest will be published every week.  Please define critical milestones for this project. Critical milestones are meant to show good-faith efforts to accomplish the project. Non-completion of these milestones could lead to revocation of remaining grant rewards. Do not use distribution of the grant itself as a milestone: Critical Milestone is:  Publish an update on this thread that details the quests initiated to date, how many users attempted each, how many successfully completed the quests, and how much of the grant was given out. This will occur no later than 6 weeks from receipt of OP tokens. If the grant plan needs adjustment based on learnings from the first 6 weeks, those will be communicated clearly in this update.  The team’s wallets will be excluded from both rewards and any key metrics being measured. If the OP tokens are for direct distribution to users, why will incentivized users and liquidity on Optimism remain after incentives dry up?: The stickiness of the Optimism ecosystem is dependent on user engagements. The program will attempt to create a community of educated and power users of the optimism ecosystem who are likely to stay engaged in the Optimism ecosystem and contribute to the growth of the ecosystem after the incentive period. Please provide any additional information that will facilitate accountability (smart contracts addresses relevant to the proposal, relevant organizational wallet addresses, etc.): Same as L2 recipient address Optimism Relationship Does your project solve a problem for the Optimism ecosystem? If so how?: Why will this solution be a source of growth for the Optimism ecosystem?: Optimism is one of the largest Ethereum L2 network with a growing ecosystem. Optimism has released the OP token in 2022 as a way to incentivize participation and growth in the Optimism ecosystem. Growing the ecosystem requires participation of many different stakeholders from various communities to work toward a common purpose to move users who are priced out of Ethereum main net to Optimism. The OP token is a great way to incentivize participation in the Optimism ecosystem. OP tokens will be used to incentivize the Optiland NFT community to learn more about the different dapps that exist in the Optimism ecosystem including defi, NFTs, bridges, Wallets, Onramp, and tools. Learning about the different protocols that exist in the Optimism ecosystem is the first step toward onboarding users to those protocols. The distribution program aims to increase participation and engagements in the optimism ecosystem. The program aims to drive up OP token adoption and gas usage which will ultimately benefit the ecosystem and further increase the adoption of the Optimism network. Optimism native?: Yes Confirmations I understand that I will be required to provide additional KYC information to the Optimism Foundation to receive this grant: [Yes/No]: Yes I understand that I will be expected to following the public grant reporting requirements outlined here: [Yes/No]: Yes
content.GPT-summary: The post is a grant proposal for the Optiland NFT series, which consists of four NFT collections. The proposal aims to incentivize program participants to learn more about the different dapps on Optimism through a series of "learn and earn" quests. The grant will be distributed over 16 weeks, making 1,250 weekly distributions to the Optiland NFT community. The post includes details about the project, the team, the grant plan, and the milestones. The post also provides links to the project's website, Twitter, and Discord, as well as metrics on the project's current status.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal

content.content: Very nice. What mechanism is used for sybil filtering? Is there is a requirement to hold multiple collections in order to participate in some of the educational quests by creating a tier system for the holders who have more than one collection? This may increase the stickiness of the project and provide a higher level of on chain recognition for the most dedicated members of the ecosystem in Optiland Quests token rewards program. Resulting in larger rewards for users of this caliber and prevent mercenaries from purchasing the cheaper collection out of the four that are a part of the program or opening multiple wallets to farm the token rewards. Any other mechanism to increase the impact of one user who is easy to identify on chain rather than the profit many will try to make from farming. I hope this helps and love the bunnies on the website as your team pictures.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: Thank you!  There would be a manual verification process at the end of each weekly quest to review each entry to make sure the responses are valid and eliminate obvious farming attempts. The goal is to educate our community on the different protocols that exist on optimism so they are more likely to stay engaged within the ecosystem and believe in the utilities of holding OP.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal

content.content: Have you thought about using Tide? Tide has an audience system to mitigate Sybil attacks and fake engagement; for example, you can make the campaign accessible only to Optimism Bridgers. Moreover, they have a permissionless campaign builder to launch web3 marketing programs with a few clicks (including learn-to-earn initiatives) By mid/end of April, you will also be able to distribute ERC-20 tokens directly from Tide. For example, Subli, a web3 educator focused on Optimism, got a grant to grow its educational account and will leverage Tide: https://twitter.com/Subli_Defi/status/1632127033399730176. For full disclosure, I work for Tide. Website: https://www.tideprotocol.xyz/
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party or author wants to collaborate on proposal
None of the topics listed match

content.content: My question was on the token distribution aspect and I’m glad that you mention they will have that soon. Thanks for putting this out there.
Moreover, through Tide, it is possible to eliminate the manual work of the tier system based on holding one or more NFTs.

Thank you for submitting this grant application! Throughout the application process, this forum thread will be one of the official means of communication. Please be sure to monitor it for updates over the course of the review period. At this stage, applications are mainly being reviewed for completeness, and nothing at this stage should be construed as support or opposition by any members of the Grants Council.     Cryptofox:  Proposal for token distribution:  We will use quest3 as a platform to set up weekly “learn and earn” quests to program participants. 100% of the tokens will be distributed to participants over 16 weeks.    Not strictly necessary, but is there a past or draft version of one of these that we could see as an example?     Cryptofox:  Milestones can be measured on:  Milestones will be met weekly and will include a weekly quest and a review of the quest from the previous week.    We recommend more specificity. For example, your benchmark milestones could be, “Launch a new quest every Monday and publicize it on communications channels X, Y, and Z” and/or “Publish metrics that include how many users attempted and completed a quest every X weeks.”     Cryptofox:  Please define critical milestones for this project. Critical milestones are meant to show good-faith efforts to accomplish the project. Non-completion of these milestones could lead to revocation of remaining grant rewards. Do not use distribution of the grant itself as a milestone: Critical Milestone is:  Maintain weekly “learn and earn” quests for 16 weeks    For your own benefit, this should be very specific and unambiguous, since critical milestones are what unlocks each successive tranche of funding for your grant plan. An example of a possible critical milestone for this grant plan could be, “Publish an update on this thread that details the quests initiated to date, how many users attempted each, how many successfully completed the quests, and how much of the grant was given out. This will occur no later than 6 weeks from receipt of OP tokens. If the grant plan needs adjustment based on learnings from the first 6 weeks, those will be communicated clearly in this update.” Typically, we also recommend clearly stating that team wallets will be excluded from both rewards and any key metrics being measured. Further guidance on milestones can be found here: Milestone Assessment Thank you, and GFX Labs or other Grants Council members will follow up here with any further questions throughout the process. Do not hesitate to ask questions here (tagging whichever Council Member a question is for, or @GrantsOps generally, will increase the speed of response).

content.content: Thank you for the thoughtful response.  I will make some updates to the milestone based on what you suggested shortly. I will try to come up with an example quest by the end of the week.
